card.description: European officials reportedly discussed potential U.S.-backed "Article 5-type" security guarantees for Ukraine with President Donald Trump as part of wider conversations about a possible peace deal.
card.title: Europe, Trump Talk 'Article 5-Type' Security Guarantees for Ukraine

content: DEVELOPING: European officials reportedly discussed potential U.S.-backed "Article 5-type" security guarantees for Ukraine with President Donald Trump as part of wider conversations about a possible peace deal. https://www.newsmax.com/globaltalk/nato-europe-ukraine/2025/08/16/id/1222714/

card.description: Although President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin kept mum on what was discussed during their high-stakes meeting Friday in Alaska, details have emerged about what Russia and Ukraine are demanding for a peace deal.
card.title: Finnerty: Ukraine, Russia Have 5 Demands Each to End War

content: "The problem here is that Europe has let Russia push them around since World War II," Sen. Roger Marshall, R-Kan., told NEWSMAX's Rob Finnerty on Friday. "America is willing to help, but Europe needs to take the bull by the horns here and tell Mr. Putin to go fly a kite." https://www.newsmax.com/newsmax-tv/rob-finnerty-russia-ukraine/2025/08/15/id/1222697/

card.description: Following are reactions from world leaders Saturday to the summit between President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin, which did not resolve Moscow's war in Ukraine.
card.title: World Leaders React to Summit Reaching 'No Deal' on Ceasefire

content: "A GLIMMER OF HOPE": World leaders from the European Union and NATO reacted Saturday to the summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin, and to an announced meeting this week with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the White House. More: https://bit.ly/45Qu8Ga

card.description: President Donald Trump's face-to-face high-stakes summit with President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on Friday could determine the fate of European security as well as the trajectory of the war in Ukraine. The exclusion of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy already deals a heavy blow...
card.title: Trump en Route to High-Stakes Meeting With Putin

content: President Trump's face-to-face, high-stakes summit with President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on Friday could determine the fate of European security, as well as the trajectory of the war in Ukraine. MORE: https://bit.ly/3JhTi7Z

card.title: NEWSMAX TV | Live News | Videos - Find NewsmaxTV

content:
COMING UP: U.S. Ambassador to NATO Matt Whitaker joins “Newsline” to talk about President Trump’s virtual meeting with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and European leaders, the latest in Israel, and more — TODAY at 12 PM ET on NEWSMAX.

WATCH: https://www.newsmaxtv.com/findus

card.description: Shares charged higher Wednesday in Europe and Asia after U.S. stocks hit new records when data showed inflation across the United States improved slightly last month.
card.title: World Shares Charge Higher After US Stocks Hit Records

content: Shares charged higher Wednesday in Europe and Asia after U.S. stocks hit new records when data showed inflation across the United States improved slightly last month. https://bit.ly/4fxSojA

card.description: President Donald Trump on Monday described his upcoming summit with Vladimir Putin as a "feel-out meeting" to gauge his ideas for ending the war in Ukraine, as European leaders rushed to ensure respect for Kyiv's interests.
card.title: Trump: Going to See What Putin Has in Mind on Ukraine

content: President Donald Trump on Monday described his upcoming summit with Vladimir Putin as a "feel-out meeting" to gauge his ideas for ending the war in Ukraine, as European leaders rushed to ensure respect for Kyiv's interests. https://bit.ly/45gvycZ

account.note: John Solomon is an award-winning investigative journalist and the CEO and Editor of Just the News.

card.description: The meeting between the two world leaders is already underway and Trump has stated that he hopes to see a ceasefire come from the summit, but that he would not directly accept one on Ukraine's behalf.
card.title: Pope Leo prays for peace in Europe amid Trump-Putin summit in Alaska

card.description: The White House earlier Wednesday indicated that President Donald Trump would meet with Putin sometime in the near future about a possible resolution to the Ukraine War, though no clear timeline for the meeting was laid out.
